intro: Melicope lobocarpa, commonly known as the Hawaiian melicope, is a tropical tree native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of rainforests and is often found in montane habitats. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that contains a single seed. Melicope lobocarpa plays an important ecological role in its native environment, supporting various insect and bird species.
